block.p: Sandra Michelle Drucker, a daughter of Marygrace and Martin Drucker of Livingston, N.J., was married yesterday to Christopher James Wright, the son of Robert C. Wright, the president and chief executive of NBC, and Suzanne Wright of Fairfield, Conn. The Rev. James Smith, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University in New York.
The couple graduated from Colgate University, where they met.

Sandra Michelle Drucker, a daughter of Marygrace and Martin Drucker of Livingston, N.J., was married yesterday to Christopher James Wright, the son of Robert C. Wright, the president and chief executive of NBC, and Suzanne Wright of Fairfield, Conn. The Rev. James Smith, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University in New York.
The couple graduated from Colgate University, where they met.

The bride, 26, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the director of business development in the e-commerce group at J. Crew, the catalog and retailing company in New York. Her father works in Pine Brook, N.J., as the vice president for international sales of the Nu Horizons Electronics Company, a distributor of electronic components. Her mother teaches kindergarten at the Redwood School in West Orange, N.J.

The bridegroom, 27, is studying for an M.B.A. at Columbia. Until last summer, he was an associate producer of ''The Olympic Show'' on CNBC. His mother is a trustee of Sarah Lawrence College in Yonkers and a director of the Inner City Foundation for Charity and Education in Bridgeport, Conn.
